title: Jesús Martínez
text:
Mathematical scientist with professional experience in the Oil & Gas industry. My contributions range from numerical methods to a variety of statistical analysis.
Starting in 2024, I joined Oxy’s newly formed Subsurface Innovation Lab (SIL) where I focus on using state-of-the-art ML techniques to improve our seismic interpretation efforts.

I’m an individual who enjoys making a difference at the technical level but also as a group member. I believe that developing valuable tools and insights is an iterative and collaborative process.
I’m also interested in computational methods to analyze Multiplexed Immunofluorescence image data. Specifically, I’m interested in spatial methods to draw insights from point-process patterns.

 Download my cv.





 ML for Seismic Interpretation Manager | Mar 2024 - Present  Occidental Petroleum  Houston, TX
 Senior Analytics Engineer | Jan 2021 - Mar 2024  Occidental Petroleum  Houston, TX
 Mathematical Scientist | Sep 2016 - Jan 2021  Occidental Petroleum  Houston, TX
 Assistant Professor | Sep 2016 - Jan 2021  Mercy College of Health Sciences  Des Moines, IA
 Graduate Teaching Assistant | Aug 2010 – May 2015  Iowa State University  Ames, IA



 PhD in Applied Mathematics | 2010 - 2015  Iowa State University
 BS in Mathematics | 2006 - 2009  University of Texas Pan-American



 Mathematics, Statistics, Programming
 Tennis, Birds, Music, Fishing

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog.
I’m still searching deep inside for the motivation to document things I find interesting and publish them. I’ve found it hard to stay motivated when using other media but Quarto has really impressed me. I began using it at work and it is surprisingly easy to use.

title: Jesús Martínez
text:
Welcome To My Blog
